#Text=THE KING OF THE GREEKS
#Text=BIG ALEC had never been captured by the fish patrol .
#Text=It was his boast that no man could take him alive , and it was his history that of the many men who had tried to take him dead none had succeeded .
#Text=It was also history that at least two patrolmen who had tried to take him dead had died themselves .
#Text=Further , no man violated the fish laws more systematically and deliberately than Big Alec .
#Text=He was called “ Big Alec ” because of his gigantic stature .
#Text=His height was six feet three inches , and he was correspondingly broad-shouldered and deep-chested .
#Text=He was splendidly muscled and hard as steel , and there were innumerable stories in circulation among the fisher-folk concerning his prodigious strength .
#Text=He was as bold and dominant of spirit as he was strong of body , and because of this he was widely known by another name , that of “ The King of the Greeks . ”
#Text=The fishing population was largely composed of Greeks , and they looked up to him and obeyed him as their chief .

#Text=And as their chief , he fought their fights for them , saw that they were protected , saved them from the law when they fell into its clutches , and made them stand by one another and himself in time of trouble .

#Text=In the old days , the fish patrol had attempted his capture many disastrous times and had finally given it over , so that when the word was out that he was coming to Benicia , I was most anxious to see him . But I did not have to hunt him up .
#Text=In his usual bold way , the first thing he did on arriving was to hunt us up .
#Text=Charley Le Grant and I at the time were under a patrolman named Carmintel , and the three of us were on the Reindeer , preparing for a trip , when Big Alec stepped aboard .
#Text=Carmintel evidently knew him , for they shook hands in recognition .
#Text=Big Alec took no notice of Charley or me .
#Text=“ I ’ve come down to fish sturgeon a couple of months , ” he said to Carmintel .
#Text=His eyes flashed with challenge as he spoke , and we noticed the patrolman ’s eyes drop before him .
#Text=“ That ’s all right , Alec , ” Carmintel said in a low voice .
#Text=“ I ’ll not bother you .
#Text=Come on into the cabin , and we ’ll talk things over , ” he added .
#Text=When they had gone inside and shut the doors after them , Charley winked with slow deliberation at me .
#Text=But I was only a youngster , and new to men and the ways of some men , so I did not understand .
#Text=Nor did Charley explain , though I felt there was something wrong about the business .
#Text=Leaving them to their conference , at Charley ’s suggestion we boarded our skiff and pulled over to the Old Steamboat Wharf , where Big Alec ’s ark was lying .
#Text=An ark is a house-boat of small though comfortable dimensions , and is as necessary to the Upper Bay fisherman as are nets and boats .
#Text=We were both curious to see Big Alec ’s ark , for history said that it had been the scene of more than one pitched battle , and that it was riddled with bullet-holes .
#Text=We found the holes ( stopped with wooden plugs and painted over ) , but there were not so many as I had expected .

#Text=Charley noted my look of disappointment , and laughed ; and then to comfort me he gave an authentic account of one expedition which had descended upon Big Alec ’s floating home to capture him , alive preferably , dead if necessary .
#Text=At the end of half a day ’s fighting , the patrolmen had drawn off in wrecked boats , with one of their number killed and three wounded .
#Text=And when they returned next morning with reinforcements they found only the mooring-stakes of Big Alec ’s ark ; the ark itself remained hidden for months in the fastnesses of the Suisun tules .
#Text=“ But why was he not hanged for murder ? ” I demanded .
#Text=“ Surely the United States is powerful enough to bring such a man to justice . ”
#Text=“ He gave himself up and stood trial , ”
#Text=Charley answered .
#Text=“ It cost him fifty thousand dollars to win the case , which he did on technicalities and with the aid of the best lawyers in the state .
#Text=Every Greek fisherman on the river contributed to the sum .
#Text=Big Alec levied and collected the tax , for all the world like a king .
#Text=The United States may be all-powerful , my lad , but the fact remains that Big Alec is a king inside the United States , with a country and subjects all his own . ”
#Text=“ But what are you going to do about his fishing for sturgeon ?
#Text=He ’s bound to fish with a ‘ Chinese line . ’ ”
#Text=Charley shrugged his shoulders .
#Text=“ We ’ll see what we will see , ” he said enigmatically .
#Text=Now a “ Chinese line ” is a cunning device invented by the people whose name it bears .
#Text=By a simple system of floats , weights , and anchors , thousands of hooks , each on a separate leader , are suspended at a distance of from six inches to a foot above the bottom .
#Text=The remarkable thing about such a line is the hook .
#Text=It is barbless , and in place of the barb , the hook is filed long and tapering to a point as sharp as that of a needle .

#Text=These hoods are only a few inches apart , and when several thousand of them are suspended just above the bottom , like a fringe , for a couple of hundred fathoms , they present a formidable obstacle to the fish that travel along the bottom .
